# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `h_hypertension`
* Variable label: `History of Hypertension`
* Variable description: `history of hypertension or high blood pressure`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | NOT High blood pressure or hypertension 
1        | High blood pressure or hypertension

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

* Short name: `h_hypertension_age`
* Variable label: `Age first diagnosed hypertension`
* Variable description: `The age first told had hypertension diagnosis`
* Domain: `Diseases`
* Value type: `Continuous`
* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

# Data process



## Poland

### Wave 1

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `d_ht140_90` |
|-|-|
| **Label** | `Hypertension >140/90 or treated`|
| **Table name**  | `Po_baseline_etic`|
| **Categories** | `0 = No`<br/>`1 = Yes` |
| **Missings** | `NA` |
| **Description** |  |

```{r assign pol_w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'HAPIEE_pol_w1','HAPIEE.Po_baseline_etic',variables=list('d_ht140_90'), missings = T)
HAPIEE_pol_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'HAPIEE_pol_w1')

```

```{r local pol_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- HAPIEE_pol_w1$d_ht140_90
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(HAPIEE_pol_w1)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HAPIEE_pol_w1, aes(x=factor(d_ht140_90))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

Age of diagnosis cannot be harmonized.

**R script:**

```{r harmo pol_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
HAPIEE_ds_pol_w1 <- tibble(id=HAPIEE_pol_w1$id)
HAPIEE_ds_pol_w1$h_hypertension <- car::recode(HAPIEE_pol_w1$d_ht140_90, "NA=999")

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript pol_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- HAPIEE_ds_pol_w1$h_hypertension
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(HAPIEE_ds_pol_w1, aes(x=factor(h_hypertension))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation pol_w1, echo=F}

AfterH <- table(HAPIEE_ds_pol_w1$h_hypertension, useNA = "ifany")
BeforeH <- table(HAPIEE_pol_w1$d_ht140_90, useNA = "ifany")
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("0->0","1->1","NA->999")
kable(C)
rm(HAPIEE_pol_w1)

```

|-|-|-|-|-|
| **Label** | `Ever told by doctor that you have high blood pressure?`|`year of birth`|`year of interview`|`year of interview`|
| **Table name**  | `Po_reexamination_etic`|`ybirth`|`yintw`|`yintw`|

```{r assign pol_w2, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'HAPIEE_pol_w2','HAPIEE.Po_reexamination_etic',variables=list('w2h14'), missings = T)
HAPIEE_pol_w2 <- opal.execute(o,'HAPIEE_pol_w2')
load(paste0(datafolder,"pol_w2/ybirth.RData"))
HAPIEE_pol_w2 <- left_join(HAPIEE_pol_w2,ybirth, by="id")
load(paste0(datafolder,"pol_w1/yintw.RData"))

load(paste0(datafolder,"pol_w2/yintw.RData"))
HAPIEE_pol_w2 <- left_join(HAPIEE_pol_w2,yintw, by="id")
names(HAPIEE_pol_w2)[5] <- "yintw_pol_w2"
rm(yintw)

```

```{r local pol_w2, echo=F}

vbl <- HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = c('.b','.c'))[3], caption = names(HAPIEE_pol_w2)[2])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = c('.b','.c'))[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HAPIEE_pol_w2, aes(x=factor(w2h14))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- HAPIEE_pol_w2$ybirth
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = names(HAPIEE_pol_w2)[3])
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(HAPIEE_pol_w2, aes(ybirth)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(1930,1960)

vbl <- HAPIEE_pol_w2$yintw_pol_w1
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(HAPIEE_pol_w2)[4])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(HAPIEE_pol_w2, aes(x=factor(yintw_pol_w1))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- HAPIEE_pol_w2$yintw_pol_w2
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = names(HAPIEE_pol_w2)[5])
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")

```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `d_ht140_90 == 0 and w2h14 == 'no' into 0`
* `d_ht140_90 == 1 or w2h14 == 'yes' into 1`
* `.b into 997`
* `.c into 998`
* `otherwise into 999`

To compute `h_hypertension_age` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `if h_hypertension == 1 in w2 and 0 in w1, h_hypertension_age = (year of interview w2-year of interview w1)/2+(year of interview w1 -ybirth)`
* `if h_hypertension == 0, h_hypertension_age = 996`
* `h_hypertension == missing into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo pol_w2}

HAPIEE_pol_w2 <- left_join(HAPIEE_pol_w2, HAPIEE_ds_pol_w1, by = "id")

# Categorical variable harmonization
HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2 <- tibble(id=HAPIEE_pol_w2$id)
HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension <- rep(999,length(HAPIEE_pol_w2$id))
HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension[which(HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14 == 'no' & (HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension != 1 | is.na(HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension)))] <- 0
HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension[which(HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14 == 'yes' | ((!is.na(HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14)) & HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension == 1))] <- 1
HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension[which(HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14 == '.b' & (HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension != 1 | is.na(HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension)))] <- 997
HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension[which(HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14 == '.c' & (HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension != 1 | is.na(HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension)))] <- 998

# Continuous variable harmonization
HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension_age <- rep(999,length(HAPIEE_pol_w2$id))
HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension == 0)] <- 996
HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension_age[which(HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension == 1 & HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension==0)] <- (HAPIEE_pol_w2$yintw_pol_w2[which(HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension == 1 & HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension==0)]+HAPIEE_pol_w2$yintw_pol_w1[which(HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension == 1 & HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension==0)])/2-HAPIEE_pol_w2$ybirth[which(HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension == 1 & HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension==0)]

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript pol_w2, echo=F}

vbl <- HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2, aes(x=factor(h_hypertension))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension_age
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_age)
kable(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2, aes(h_hypertension_age)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_age) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(45,75)

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation pol_w2, echo=F, results='asis'}

AfterH <- table(HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2$h_hypertension, useNA = "ifany")
X <- c(
  sum(((!is.na(HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14)) & HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14 == 'no') & (HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension != 1)),
  sum(((!is.na(HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14)) & HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14 == 'yes') | ((!is.na(HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension)) & (!is.na(HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14)) & HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension == 1)),
  sum(((!is.na(HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14)) & HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14 == '.b') & (HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension != 1)),
  sum(((!is.na(HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14)) & HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14 == '.c') & (HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension != 1))
)
BeforeH <- c(X[1:4],length(HAPIEE_pol_w2$id)-sum(X))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("'no'->0","'yes'->1",".b->997",".c->998","NA->999")
kable(C)

cat("There are 695 individuals who had hypertension in the previous wave and in the second wave answer that they were not told to have it. We harmonize them as having hypertension")
kable(frq(HAPIEE_pol_w2$h_hypertension[HAPIEE_pol_w2$w2h14=='no']), align = 'c')

rm(HAPIEE_pol_w2)

```

```{r crosstabulation cz_w2, echo=F, results='asis'}
  sum(((!is.na(HAPIEE_cz_w2$w2h14)) & HAPIEE_cz_w2$w2h14 == 'yes') | ((!is.na(HAPIEE_cz_w2$h_hypertension)) & (!is.na(HAPIEE_cz_w2$w2h14)) & HAPIEE_cz_w2$h_hypertension == 1))
)
BeforeH <- c(X[1:2],length(HAPIEE_cz_w2$id)-sum(X))
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("No->0","Yes->1","NA->999")
kable(C)

cat("There are 851 individuals who had hypertension in the previous wave and in the second wave answer that they were not told to have it. We harmonize them as having hypertension")
kable(frq(HAPIEE_cz_w2$h_hypertension[HAPIEE_cz_w2$w2h14=='no']), align = 'c')

rm(HAPIEE_cz_w2)

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `h_hypertension` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep up 0 into 0`
* `keep up 1 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

Age of diagnosis cannot be harmonized.

**R script:**

```{r harmo li_w1}

# Categorical variable harmonization
HAPIEE_ds_li_w1 <- tibble(id=HAPIEE_li_w1$id)
HAPIEE_ds_li_w1$h_hypertension <- car::recode(HAPIEE_li_w1$d_ht140_90, "NA=999")

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript li_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- HAPIEE_ds_li_w1$h_hypertension
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(HAPIEE_ds_li_w1, aes(x=factor(h_hypertension))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

## Descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable by cohort:

**R script:**

```{r summ}

lb.hds <- list(pol_w1 = HAPIEE_ds_pol_w1, cz_w1 = HAPIEE_ds_cz_w1, li_w1 = HAPIEE_ds_li_w1)
lf.hds <- list(pol_w2 = HAPIEE_ds_pol_w2, cz_w2 = HAPIEE_ds_cz_w2)

for(name in names(lb.hds)) {
  aux_object <- lb.hds[[name]]
  label(lb.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  lb.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(lb.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cat_label)
  aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
  aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cat_label[1:2])
  m_name <- paste0("HAPIEE_m_ds_",name)
  assign(m_name, aux_object)
  rm(aux_object)
}

for(name in names(lf.hds)) {
  aux_object <- lf.hds[[name]]
  label(lf.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  lf.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(lf.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cat_label)
  label(lf.hds[[name]][[3]]) <- label(aux_object[[3]]) <- ds_label_age # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  lf.hds[[name]][[3]] <- labelled(lf.hds[[name]][[3]], labels = cont_label)

  aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cat_label[1:2])
  m_name <- paste0("HAPIEE_m_ds_",name)
  assign(m_name, aux_object)
  rm(aux_object)
}
```

# Quality estimation
* We assume that if an individual has hypertension in one wave, it has for all the next waves. Individuals with discrepancies with respect to this criterium are specified at the end of each validation.
* For the baseline waves there is also the study-specific variable `h14` which asks `Ever been told by a doctor you have high blood pressure`.
